attachments.title: The EU Failed the World's Easiest Cost-Benefit Test - Marginal REVOLUTION
attachments.text: From early on in the crisis I was telling governments, “this is the world’s easiest cost-benefit test” because: The EU response: However, the EU approach came with strings. The commission, negotiating for the first time on vital medicines, felt that EU countries would demand value for money, so it dragged out the talks to secure […]
attachments.fallback: Marginal REVOLUTION: The EU Failed the World's Easiest Cost-Benefit Test - Marginal REVOLUTION

text: I don't know much about this, but I think the EU argues that vaccine companies are basically already producing as much as they possibly can, so starting a bidding war will just mean someone else gets the vaccine later, not that people overall get the vaccine faster.

text: I'm very much against fast-tracking anything for the sake of getting it out quickly.
